messages.message: Hi team - I had a good call with a community user that wants to move onto commercial. They had the feedback that there were changes over the last two days which broke their current integration. He asked if we provide information ahead of time to inform of these types of changes in the future?
@Ram Prasanna is there anything more we can do with releases to proactively inform internal and external (customers) teams on when releases are about to happen?

@Ben Wood we definitely could have been more proactive about communicating to customers on this one, but I think the reason we didn’t was that we didn’t see it as “breaking” their integrations. If they had a downstream integration on an app, they should see a message that integrations on apps are no longer supported and guiding them through creating a deployment with that same integration. Did this migration path not work for them, or did they not want to do it? cc @hannah

Ahhh I think the miss here is that community users don’t have access to deployments (where integrations are now configured) and so they probably were not prompted to create a deployment and so it just broke for them. For commercial users, the migration path is seamless as we prompt them through the new workflow. This is definitely on me. We should have caught this and proactively communicated to any impacted community users.
Oh I didn’t know we even allowed community users to create downstream integrations on apps, I’ll double check the code for that. I figured this was a commercial trial or something
Hmm yeah in the code integrations for apps are commercial only
reading the notes above. On the communication part,  let me chat with @hannah and rest of PM team offline on how we can communicate earlier to customers for changes like this going forward.
Thanks! The change also impacted SE demos so additional comms (e.g. internal email) immediately before the changes would also be great
